Tag colors are a great idea, especially when combined with filters to set the tags. 

BUT - if I tag something with two tags, then it takes the color of the first (alphabetically I think). This makes sense if BOTH have colors, but if I have for example "call" and "project1" and "project2"  and pick green for Project 1 and red for "Project2", then I really don't want those colors to disappear if I also tag it with "call" which has no color specified. 


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Create a tag MMMM with color Red
2.Create a tag AAAA - don't set a color
3. Tag something MMMM - it changes to red
4. Tag same item AAAA - the color disappears (defaults to black).
I think it should stay red.

comments.creator: bugzilla@kabsi.de
comments.text:
I think it is not a bug but rather expected behaviour:

- new tags are sorted alphabetically.
- order of tags defines tag priority. 
- If a message has multiple tags, tags with highest priority wins and defines color of message.

=> AAA wins over MMM.
=> Tag AAA has default color which is black
=> color seems to disappear.

This behaviour might reveal several shortcomings of the current tagging system. Most of them have already been reported:

Bug #528034: UI for manually changing tag order
Bug #352869: color picker does not represent default black color properly.

I think one could dupe it with bug #352869. Currently tags always have a color (even if it defaults to black). If the color picker would show black instead of grey (or transparency), there would be no misunderstanding.

On the other hand one could see this as a feature request to allow for "colorless" tags (i.e. tags that do not influence color, tags that are "transparent" in terms of color).
